meanings.definition: An organized effort to oppose or respond to a campaign.
meanings.sent1: The countercampaign aimed to stop the harmful messages of the main campaign.
meanings.sent2: The countercampaign gained support from many people who disagreed with the initial campaign.
meanings.sent3: The countercampaign used humor to show the flaws in the opponent's campaign.
meanings.sent4: The countercampaign was a shield against the misleading tactics of the rival campaign.
meanings.sent5: The countercampaign stood out with its clear message against the main campaign.

meanings.definition: To engage in a campaign that opposes or responds to another campaign.
meanings.sent1: They decided to countercampaign against the false claims made by their competitors.
meanings.sent2: She actively countercampaigned to ensure the truth was heard by all.
meanings.sent3: He countercampaigned with determination and a touch of creativity.
meanings.sent4: The team countercampaigned fiercely, showing their dedication to their cause.
meanings.sent5: Countercampaigning effectively required strategic planning and swift action.
